content: tessellated sampler cowl pattern by abbeymade the tessellated sampler cowl is the perfect introduction to tunisian entrelac crochet it will introduce a beginner to the basic principles of working entrelac in row panels and in the round for a bit of fun every second panel is made using a different stitch combination no specialist tunisian hooks required - a short crochet hook will suit cowl is set when you make the first panel of triangles the sample cowl made 16 triangles to start resulting in a cowl that measures 98cm/38 5 circumference after wet blocking for a smaller circumference i suggest no less than 8 triangles to start for an adult which would result in a finished diameter of about 49cm/19 3 the height of the cowl if you make every panel in the pattern is 27cm/10 5 gauge and yarn weights gauge is not vital for this pattern simply because it s a cowl if you find that your stitches are too tight or too loose using 8 ply dk yarn with a 6mm hook please adjust to suit your preference this also means you can use any fibre weight and hook size you desire the pattern will work just as well in 4 ply fingering weight and 12 ply worsted as it does in the 8 ply dk weight that i used for the sample please feel free to experiment with what you have in your stash in any yarn weight abbreviations symbols & terminology abbrev meaning method tss tunisian
